alert.note: Alert for Coke; Nolan (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 5:26PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Coke and southern Nolan Counties through 630 PM CDT... At 525 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm roughly 10 miles north of Broome in western Coke County, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Robert Lee, Blackwell, Bronte, Maryneal, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Silver, Fort Chadbourne, Sanco, Tennyson, The Intersection Of Highway 208 And Ranch Road 2662, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059, Us-87 Near The Coke- Tom Green County Line and Oak Creek Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
